DataElement.preferredName: Atypia Nevi Histologic Grade Method Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The method used to assist with the grading of atypia of a piece of the nevi.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to the cell of a pigmented cutaneous nevus that differs from a normal melanocyte in that it lacks dendrites and practiced and regimented skill or series of actions used to classify cancer cells in terms of how abnormal they appear when examined under a microscope and information about the probable growth rate of the tumor and its tendency to spread.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:The cell of a pigmented cutaneous nevus that differs from a normal melanocyte in that it lacks dendrites. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: The condition of being irregular or not conforming to type.
A neoplastic cutaneous melanocyte that characterizes benign and atypical cutaneous neoplastic lesions called nevi.

Property.preferredDefinition: The degree of abnormality of cancer cells, a measure of differentiation, the extent to which cancer cells are similar in appearance and function to healthy cells of the same tissue type. The degree of differentiation often relates to the clinical behavior of the particular tumor. Based on the microscopic findings, tumor grade is commonly described by one of four degrees of severity. Histopathologic grade of a tumor may be used to plan treatment and estimate the future course, outcome, and overall prognosis of disease. Certain types of cancers, such as soft tissue sarcoma, primary brain tumors, lymphomas, and breast have special grading systems.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

The degree of differentiation often relates to the clinical behavior of the particular tumor. Based on the microscopic findings, tumor grade is commonly described by one of four degrees of severity. Histopathologic grade of a tumor may be used to plan treatment and estimate the future course, outcome, and overall prognosis of disease. Certain types of cancers, such as soft tissue sarcoma, primary brain tumors, lymphomas, and breast have special grading systems.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The method or series of actions used to grade the intensity or amount or quality.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The microscopic study of characteristic tissue abnormalities by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.  -- 2004

Concepts.definition: The microscopic study of characteristic tissue abnormalities by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.:A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.
A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
